static const gaia::base::String gaia::text::DateUtils::ABBREV_WEEKDAY_FORMAT ( ) [static]
static gaia::base::String gaia::text::DateUtils::formatDateRange ( const gaia::core::Context &  context,
int64_t  startMillis,
int64_t  endMillis,
int32_t  flags 
) [static]

Formats a date or a time range according to the local conventions.

Note that this is a convenience method. Using it involves creating an internal java.util.Formatter instance on-the-fly, which is somewhat costly in terms of memory and time. This is probably acceptable if you use the method only rarely, but if you rely on it for formatting a large number of dates, consider creating and reusing your own java.util.Formatter instance and use the version of formatDateRange that takes a java.util.Formatter.

Parameters:
contextthe context is required only if the time is shown
startMillisthe start time in UTC milliseconds
endMillisthe end time in UTC milliseconds
flagsa bit mask of options See formatDateRange
Returns:
a string containing the formatted date/time range.
static gaia::base::String gaia::text::DateUtils::formatDateTime ( const gaia::core::Context &  context,
int64_t  millis,
int32_t  flags 
) [static]

Formats a date or a time according to the local conventions.

There are lots of options that allow the caller to control, for example, if the time is shown, if the day of the week is shown, if the month name is abbreviated, if noon is shown instead of 12pm, and so on. For the complete list of options, see the documentation for formatDateRange.

Example output strings (date formats in these examples are shown using the US date format convention but that may change depending on the local settings):

  • 10:15am
  • 3:00pm
  • 3pm
  • 3PM
  • 08:00
  • 17:00
  • noon
  • Noon
  • midnight
  • Midnight
  • Oct 31
  • Oct 31, 2007
  • October 31, 2007
  • 10am, Oct 31
  • 17:00, Oct 31
  • Wed
  • Wednesday
  • 10am, Wed, Oct 31
  • Wed, Oct 31
  • Wednesday, Oct 31
  • Wed, Oct 31, 2007
  • Wed, October 31
  • 10/31/2007
Parameters:
contextthe context is required only if the time is shown
millisa point32_t in time in UTC milliseconds
flagsa bit mask of formatting options
Returns:
a string containing the formatted date/time.
static gaia::base::String gaia::text::DateUtils::formatElapsedTime ( int64_t  elapsedSeconds) [static]

Formats an elapsed time in the form "MM:SS" or "H:MM:SS" for display on the call-in-progress screen.

Parameters:
elapsedSecondsthe elapsed time in seconds.
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::formatSameDayTime ( int64_t  then,
int64_t  now,
int32_t  dateStyle,

) [static]
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::formatSameDayTimeN ( int64_t  then,
int64_t  now,
int32_t  dateStyle,
int32_t  timeStyle 
) [static]

Format a date / time such that if the then is on the same day as now, it shows just the time and if it's a different day, it shows just the date.

The parameters dateFormat and timeFormat should each be one of java.text.DateFormat#DEFAULT, java.text.DateFormat#FULL, java.text.DateFormat#LONG, java.text.DateFormat#MEDIUM or java.text.DateFormat#SHORT

Parameters:
thenthe date to format
nowthe base time
dateStylehow to format the date portion.
timeStylehow to format the time portion.
static gaia::base::String gaia::text::DateUtils::getAMPMString ( int32_t  ampm) [static]

Return a localized string for AM or PM.

Parameters:
ampmEither JCalendar.AM or JCalendar.PM.
Exceptions:
IndexOutOfBoundsExceptionif the ampm is out of bounds.
Returns:
Localized version of "AM" or "PM".
static gaia::base::String gaia::text::DateUtils::getDayOfWeekString ( int32_t  dayOfWeek,
int32_t  abbrev 
) [static]

Return a string for the day of the week.

Parameters:
dayOfWeekOne of JCalendar.SUNDAY, JCalendar.MONDAY, etc.
abbrevOne of LENGTH_LONG, LENGTH_SHORT, LENGTH_MEDIUM, or LENGTH_SHORTEST. Note that in most languages, LENGTH_SHORT will return the same as LENGTH_MEDIUM. Undefined lengths will return LENGTH_MEDIUM but may return something different in the future.
Exceptions:
IndexOutOfBoundsExceptionif the dayOfWeek is out of bounds.
static gaia::base::String gaia::text::DateUtils::getMonthString ( int32_t  month,
int32_t  abbrev 
) [static]

Return a localized string for the month of the year.

Parameters:
monthOne of JCalendar.JANUARY, JCalendar.FEBRUARY, etc.
abbrevOne of LENGTH_LONG, LENGTH_MEDIUM, or LENGTH_SHORTEST. Undefined lengths will return LENGTH_MEDIUM but may return something different in the future.
Returns:
Localized month of the year.
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeDateTimeString ( const gaia::core::Context &  c,
int64_t  time,
int64_t  minResolution,
int64_t  transitionResolution,
int32_t  flags 
) [static]
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeDateTimeStringN ( const gaia::core::Context &  c,
int64_t  time,
int64_t  minResolution,
int64_t  transitionResolution,
int32_t  flags 
) [static]

Return string describing the elapsed time since startTime formatted like "[relative time/date], [time]".

Example output strings for the US date format.

  • 3 mins ago, 10:15 AM
  • yesterday, 12:20 PM
  • Dec 12, 4:12 AM
  • 11/14/2007, 8:20 AM
Parameters:
timesome time in the past.
minResolutionthe minimum elapsed time (in milliseconds) to report when showing relative times. For example, a time 3 seconds in the past will be reported as "0 minutes ago" if this is set to MINUTE_IN_MILLIS.
transitionResolutionthe elapsed time (in milliseconds) at which to stop reporting relative measurements. Elapsed times greater than this resolution will default to normal date formatting. For example, will transition from "6 days ago" to "Dec 12" when using WEEK_IN_MILLIS.
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeTimeSpanString ( const gaia::core::Context &  c,
int64_t  millis,
bool  withPreposition 
) [static]

int64_t  millis 
) [static]
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeTimeSpanString ( int64_t  startTime) [static]
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeTimeSpanString ( int64_t  time,
int64_t  now,
int64_t  minResolution 
) [static]
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeTimeSpanString ( int64_t  time,
int64_t  now,
int64_t  minResolution,
int32_t  flags 
) [static]
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeTimeSpanStringN ( const gaia::core::Context &  c,
int64_t  millis,
bool  withPreposition 
) [static]
Returns:
a relative time string to display the time expressed by millis. Times are counted starting at midnight, which means that assuming that the current time is March 31st, 0:30:
  • "millis=0:10 today" will be displayed as "0:10"
  • "millis=11:30pm the day before" will be displayed as "Mar 30"
If the given millis is in a different year, then the full date is returned in numeric format (e.g., "10/12/2008").
Parameters:
withPrepositionIf true, the string returned will include the correct preposition ("at 9:20am", "on 10/12/2008" or "on May 29").
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeTimeSpanStringN ( const gaia::core::Context &  c,
int64_t  millis 
) [static]

Convenience function to return relative time string without preposition.

Parameters:
ccontext for resources
millistime in milliseconds
Returns:
CharSequence containing relative time.
See also:
#getRelativeTimeSpanStringN(Context, long, boolean)
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeTimeSpanStringN ( int64_t  time,
int64_t  now,
int64_t  minResolution,
int32_t  flags 
) [static]

Returns a string describing 'time' as a time relative to 'now'.

Time spans in the past are formatted like "42 minutes ago". Time spans in the future are formatted like "in 42 minutes".

Can use FORMAT_ABBREV_RELATIVE flag to use abbreviated relative times, like "42 mins ago".

Parameters:
timethe time to describe, in milliseconds
nowthe current time in milliseconds
minResolutionthe minimum timespan to report. For example, a time 3 seconds in the past will be reported as "0 minutes ago" if this is set to MINUTE_IN_MILLIS. Pass one of 0, MINUTE_IN_MILLIS, HOUR_IN_MILLIS, DAY_IN_MILLIS, WEEK_IN_MILLIS
flagsa bit mask of formatting options, such as FORMAT_NUMERIC_DATE or FORMAT_ABBREV_RELATIVE
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeTimeSpanStringN ( int64_t  startTime) [static]

Returns a string describing the elapsed time since startTime.

Parameters:
startTimesome time in the past.
Returns:
a String object containing the elapsed time.
See also:
#getRelativeTimeSpanStringN(long, long, long)
static gaia::base::CharSequence* gaia::text::DateUtils::getRelativeTimeSpanStringN ( int64_t  time,
int64_t  now,
int64_t  minResolution 
) [static]

Returns a string describing 'time' as a time relative to 'now'.

Time spans in the past are formatted like "42 minutes ago". Time spans in the future are formatted like "in 42 minutes".

Parameters:
timethe time to describe, in milliseconds
nowthe current time in milliseconds
minResolutionthe minimum timespan to report. For example, a time 3 seconds in the past will be reported as "0 minutes ago" if this is set to MINUTE_IN_MILLIS. Pass one of 0, MINUTE_IN_MILLIS, HOUR_IN_MILLIS, DAY_IN_MILLIS, WEEK_IN_MILLIS

Definition at line 27 of file DateUtils.h.

const int32_t gaia::text::DateUtils::LENGTH_LONG = 10 [static]

Request the full spelled-out name.

For use with the 'abbrev' parameter of getDayOfWeekString and getMonthString.

e.g. "Sunday" or "January"

Definition at line 66 of file DateUtils.h.

const int32_t gaia::text::DateUtils::LENGTH_MEDIUM = 20 [static]

Request an abbreviated version of the name.

For use with the 'abbrev' parameter of getDayOfWeekString and getMonthString.

e.g. "Sun" or "Jan"

Definition at line 75 of file DateUtils.h.

const int32_t gaia::text::DateUtils::LENGTH_SHORT = 30 [static]

Request a shorter abbreviated version of the name.

For use with the 'abbrev' parameter of getDayOfWeekString and getMonthString.

e.g. "Su" or "Jan"

In most languages, the results returned for LENGTH_SHORT will be the same as the results returned for LENGTH_MEDIUM.

Definition at line 85 of file DateUtils.h.

const int32_t gaia::text::DateUtils::LENGTH_SHORTER = 40 [static]

Request an even shorter abbreviated version of the name.

Do not use this. Currently this will always return the same result as LENGTH_SHORT.

Definition at line 92 of file DateUtils.h.

const int32_t gaia::text::DateUtils::LENGTH_SHORTEST = 50 [static]

Request an even shorter abbreviated version of the name.

For use with the 'abbrev' parameter of getDayOfWeekString and getMonthString.

e.g. "S", "T", "T" or "J"

In some languages, the results returned for LENGTH_SHORTEST will be the same as the results returned for LENGTH_SHORT.
